decks.notes: The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to control the board through removal spells and counterspells, while using planeswalkers like Narset, Nissa, and Tamiyo to generate card advantage and board presence. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Uro and Hydroid Krasis to gain life, draw cards, and pressure the opponent. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and gradually taking over the game with powerful threats and card advantage.

The deck revolves around using control spells and powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy and generate card advantage. By utilizing cards like Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils to strip key cards from the opponent's hand and using Nissa, Who Shakes the World to ramp up mana quickly, the deck seeks to gain control of the game and eventually overpower the opponent with threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes various removal spells and counterspells to maintain board control and protect its own game plan.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through spells like Thought Erasure and counter magic, while generating card advantage and threats with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Eliminate and Casualties of War, eventually overwhelming the opponent with large threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Shark Typhoon. By accruing card advantage and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a game of attrition.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's hand and board by using disruptive spells like Thought Erasure, Aether Gust, and Negate. It then aims to generate value and pressure through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nightpack Ambusher. Shark Typhoon provides a threat that can create flying tokens, while Nissa, Who Shakes the World enhances the mana base and generates unbeatable board presence. The mana base is designed to allow for consistent access to all colors needed for the various spells and threats in the deck. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt and control the game until it can establish a dominant position and win.

This deck focuses on powerful and versatile threats like Hydroid Krasis, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to take control of the game. It also includes disruption spells like Brazen Borrower, Thought Erasure, and Aether Gust to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Uro and Nissa, while also having answers to control and disruption with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal like Eat to Extinction. It aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by playing efficiently and utilizing its powerful threats effectively.

The deck focuses on generating value by using adventure cards and exploiting the Lucky Clover mechanic to double the effects of spells. It aims to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Beanstalk Giant and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also providing a strong aggressive presence with cards like Brazen Borrower and Lovestruck Beast. Fae of Wishes allows for additional versatility and options, while the Great Henge provides a powerful late-game threat. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful spell effects.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and planeswalkers. By utilizing cards like Cultivate and Risen Reef, the goal is to accelerate into big plays like Genesis Ultimatum and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes cards like Soul-Guide Lantern and Scavenging Ooze to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies. With a mix of ramp, card draw, and powerful threats, this deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board while dealing direct damage to the opponent by sacrificing creatures and triggering effects like Mayhem Devil. It features cards like Claim the Firstborn, Village Rites, and Priest of Forgotten Gods to maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Bolas's Citadel to close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful creatures and spells. By leveraging cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, the player can gain card advantage and disrupt their opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, as well as board wipes such as Extinction Event and Casualties of War. With access to powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a battle of attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly playing creatures and using adventure spells to put pressure on the opponent while also generating card advantage. With the ability to consistently ramp up mana with cards like Beanstalk Giant and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and card advantage. The inclusion of Fae of Wishes allows for access to a sideboard of versatile cards, giving the deck flexibility and adaptability in various matchups.

The key concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to leverage the aggressive capabilities of the creatures in the deck, such as Fervent Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, Inspiring Veteran, and Stormfist Crusader, to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal substantial damage. The deck also includes Knights with synergy abilities like Worthy Knight and Corpse Knight to further enhance the attack strategy. Additionally, the inclusion of the Companion, Lurrus of the Dream-Den, allows for recursion and additional value through its ability to bring back small creatures from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers, such as Narset and Nissa, along with efficient removal spells and disruptive control cards to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish board control with cards like Uro and Hydroid Krasis, while also generating card advantage with Shark Typhoon. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's triple-color requirements, with a mix of shock lands, check lands, and basics. Overall, the deck looks to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of powerful threats and versatile answers.
